SEARCH
Package io.github.lycoriscafe.nexus.http.core.headers.content

Class Content

java.lang.Object
io.github.lycoriscafe.nexus.http.core.headers.content.Content
public final class Content extends Object
HTTP request/response content. 
     
     // Example code
     var content = new Content("video/mp4", Paths.get("path/to/mp4/video"))
          .setTransferEncodingChunked(true)
          .setDownloadName("SampleVideo.mp4");
Since:
v1.0.0
See Also:
  • Content(String, Path)
  • Content(String, byte[])
  • Content(String, String)
  • Content(String, InputStream)
  • HTTP Semantics (rfc9110) - 8. Representation Data and Metadata
API Note:
This version of API only supports Transfer-Encoding chunked and Content-Encoding gzip for incoming and outgoing content related encodings. Content negotiation, Conditional requests and Range requests are not yet supported by the server itself, but the API users can implement it appropriately in their code.

  • Constructor Details

    • Content

      public Content(String contentType, Path data)
      Create an instance of Content by providing Path as data. 
           
     // Example code
     Path someVideoPath = Paths.get("path/to/a/video");
     var content = new Content("video/mp4", someVideoPath);
      Parameters:
      contentType - Content-Type of the provided data
      data - Path of data
      Since:
      v1.0.0
      See Also:
      • Path
      • Content

     // Example code
     byte[] someByteArray = ...
     var content = new Content("application/octet-stream", someByteArray);

      public Content(String contentType, String data)
      Create an instance of Content by providing String as data. 
           
     // Example code
     String someString = "this is a sample string";
     var content = new Content("text/plain", someString);

    • Content

      public Content(String contentType, InputStream data)
      Create an instance of Content by providing InputStream as data. 
           
     // Example code
     var inputStream = new FileInputStream("path/to/a/pdf/file");
     var content = new Content("application/pdf", inputStream);
      Parameters:
      contentType - Content-Type of the provided data
      data - InputStream of data
      Since:
      v1.0.0

    • setDownloadName

      public Content setDownloadName(String downloadName)
      Set name for content downloading. If this is set, the Content-Disposition: attachment; filename="fileName" header will present in the request and browsers will pop a download window. 
           
     // Example code
     var path = Paths.get("SampleFile.exe");
     var content = new Content("application/octet-stream", path)
          .setDownloadName("SampleFile.exe");
      Parameters:
      downloadName - Content name for downloading process
      Returns:
      Same Content instance
      Since:
      v1.0.0
      See Also:
      • Content

      public Content setTransferEncodingChunked(boolean transferEncodingChunked)
      Set Transfer-Encoding to 'chunked'. When this is enabled, default chunk size will get by the HttpServerConfiguration.
      Parameters:
      transferEncodingChunked - Set/Unset Transfer-Encoding to 'chunked'
      Returns:
      Same Content instance
      Since:

    • getData

      public Object getData()
      Get content data. This method always return an Object. API users need to implement their own way to handle data by using the Content-Type.
      Returns:
      Data as Object
      Since:
      v1.0.0
      See Also:
      • getContentType()
      • MultipartFormData
      • UrlEncodedData
      • Path
      • Content
      API Note:
      When receiving,
      • multipart/form-data, the data should be cast to List of MultipartFormData>.
      • application/x-www-form-urlencoded, the data should cast to UrlEncodedData.
      • Transfer-Encoding: chunked, the data should cast to Path.
      • Others should cast to byte[].
